definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: US armsmakers and high-tech industries are salivating at the thought of enteringIndia's market.
sentences.chinese: 美國軍火製造商和高科技產業都在垂涎印度的市場。

sentences.english: Chinese weapons manufacturers have declined to comment on the issue.
sentences.chinese: 中國軍火商曾拒絕就此事置評。

sentences.english: Gui Yuan pointed out that the tunnel exit at the pier, entrance in the arsenal.
sentences.chinese: 桂元指出地道出口在碼頭，入口在軍火庫。
一些商人以販賣軍火賺錢。

sentences.english: Some merchants make money by way of munitions.
sentences.chinese: 一些商人以販賣軍火賺錢。

sentences.english: Suspected arms dealer Viktor Bout will stay in the custody of Thai police.
sentences.chinese: 軍火倒爺威克特布特將被泰國警察監管。

sentences.english: Everything that's happened to Mbeki is a consequence of the arms deal.
sentences.chinese: 所有關於姆貝基的一切都始於那樁軍火生意。

sentences.english: Do you carry any fire-arms or narcotics?
sentences.chinese: 你有攜帶軍火或違禁品嗎？

sentences.english: The Oshkosh Corporation is hiring 750 workers to service its military contracts.
sentences.chinese: 豪士科集團正在爲其軍火承包合約招聘750名員工。

sentences.english: Israel wants an end to rocket fire and arms-smuggling to Gaza.
sentences.chinese: 以色列要求終止火箭襲擊和向加沙走私軍火。

sentences.english: A new tool will join the censorship circumvention arsenal this September.
sentences.chinese: 這個九月，又一個新工具加入審查規避軍火庫。

sentences.english: Du from far and arms dealers nai-jen chang joint, followed by the right less.
sentences.chinese: 杜自遠和軍火販子張乃仁接頭，被右少跟蹤。

sentences.english: They arrested him Thursday on suspicion that he planned to sell weapons in Thailand.
sentences.chinese: 他由於涉嫌計劃在泰國販賣軍火於週四被捕。

sentences.english: Libyan man stands near the site of a massive explosion at an ammunition depot in Benghazi.
sentences.chinese: 班加西一名男子站在發生大爆炸的軍火庫事發點附近。

sentences.english: The technical part was designed for the autonomous work of the arsenal.
sentences.chinese: 專業部是用來從事軍火庫的自治工作的。

sentences.english: Some of the munitions merchants are real warmongers.
sentences.chinese: 某些軍火商人是真正的戰爭販子。

definition: to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
to take a risk out of desperation (idiom)
the Kempeitai or Japanese Military Police 1881-1945 (Japanese counterpart of the Gestapo during WWII)
to recruit soldiers and buy horses (idiom); to raise a large army/fig. to expand business/to recruit new staff
to gain the initiative by striking first (idiom); to preempt/to anticipate/preemptive
to use gain as a lure
to incite trouble/to stir up havoc
